name: Mas de l'Oulivie

reviews.text: Well Maintained; Clean, Manicured, managed with tender loving care!
reviews.title: Favorite Hotel of Trip So Far!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Family of four [11 year old daughter and 15 year old daughter] stayed two nights July 1 and 2. First, location is 4 minutes from Les Baux Town and Cathedral D'Image. More importantly, only 10 minutes to St. Remy- dont miss on Wednesday market day, highlight of 15 year old daughter for shopping.
reviews.title: Definitely worth visiting

likes.disliked: — Hotel doesn't serve dinner - nuisance to have to go out on first night when arriving at 7.30pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we pulled in, the grounds are immaculate, well peticured, landscaped perfectly, every bush and flower and tree hand trimmed. The owner personally directs the landscaping crew, you can tell the owner loves his property. They had gated secure parking for car [probably not needed for crime, just nice]. The pool was large irregular shaped, deep. Not standard small rectangle pool. And much, much lounging area with many chaise lounges and contiguous bar/restaurant. Previous reviews said "pool was too cold" but I checked the thermometer in the pool and it was 28 degrees [82 degrees] on July 1st. Just 20 second initial shock jumping in, but was fine, and I hate cold water, but thought it was no problem. Many others were swimming- so pool temp is non issue.
reviews.title: What's Not To Like?

likes.liked: — Location, setting, quiet, just about everything!

reviews.title: eh
reviews.text: We did sightseeing in morning and returned around 1:00 pm to relax. We highly recommend this scenario, this was the one hotel so far that we really liked to just sit, enjoy, and relax. We had lunch at Hotel restaurant, and we highly recommend this food over many cafe's at tourist trap areas. The food was unbelievable, we had excellent Provence salads, my wife had steak, potatoe and grilled vegetables that she had been craving for after two weeks of crazy French menus [according to her]. The service for lunch and breakfast, the two men that serve at the restaurant [one seems to be property manager in training] were excellent]. So enjoy relaxing here, drinks by the pool, and consider lunch as option [surprisingly excellent, better than outside cafes].

reviews.title: Je l'aime beaucoup
reviews.text: The rooms [we had two rooms across the hall from each other] were very clean and updated. We were in the main building where the lobby was, my laptop could just barely catch the wireless intenet, so had to go to lobby for wireless connection-[but no big deal, very comfortable]. Anyways, rooms were very clean, spacious, air conditioned. We were very comfortable.

My wife and I stayed at this excellent hotel in July 2004. The room was spotless and the gardens with lavender predominating were beautiful. The staff were friendly, courteous and (fortunately for us) bi-lingual and nothing was too much trouble. There is no evening restaurant but we were recommended some great eating places with reservations made for us and directions provided. There is an attractive pool - a perfect place to spend a lazy sunny afternoon. The highlights for us were the breakfasts and light lunches on the terrace - fillet steaks to die for! We plan to visit again in 2005.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing, friendly, efficient hotel
Peaceful and Gorgeous
reviews.text: I have just returned from a trip to the Provence with my wife. It is a honeymoon dream place. The hotel rooms are modern, clean and tastefully decorated. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Like the other reviewers, we hope to come back there soon.

reviews.title: Les Baux Beautiful
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here 4 days last autumn. Very tasteful and charming room kept to a very high standard. Staff pleasant and good English spoken. Help given in arranging restaurants locally. Swimming pool with surrounding grounds one of the best we have experienced anywhere. Would definitely return.

reviews.title: A bit of heaven on earth
reviews.text: My wife and I have recently spent the most magnificent 4 days imaginable at the Mas de l,Oulivie. We had a beautiful room overlooking Les Baux that was spectacular, especially in the morning when the sun turned everything to a gorgeous pink and the staff was as accomodating as they come. Will we go back the next time we travel to the Provence?

aka: Mas De l`Oulivie Hotel Les Baux De Provence
description: In the heart of an olive grove and at the foot of the steep rocky hills of les Baux de Provence, le Mas de l'Oulivie is a charming hotel with Provencal style inside and outside. The landscape swimming pool with rocks springs out the landscape like an oasis. Privileged atmosphere for Provence lovers and restaurant opened for lunch only.
